content.text:
# Analysis of the Main Target Image

## Count & Layers:
The structure consists of approximately 10 blocks arranged in multiple layers:
- Bottom layer: Orange cylinders, green rectangular blocks, and orange triangular wedges
- Middle layer: Red arch block
- Top layer: Orange triangular roof piece

## Spatial Relationships:
- The central feature is a red arch structure (resembling a doorway)
- Two orange cylindrical columns support the red arch, one on each side
- Three green rectangular blocks are positioned around the structure (two on the right, one on the left)
- Four orange triangular wedges are placed around the base of the structure
- One orange triangular piece sits on top of the red arch as a roof

# Required Blocks from the Dictionary

Based on the target structure, I need the following blocks:

1. Block index 1: Red arch block (serves as the main doorway)
2. Block index 6: Green vertical rectangular block (x2, positioned on sides)
3. Block index 7: Green horizontal rectangular block (positioned on left side)
4. Block index 9: Orange cylinder (x2, supporting the arch)
5. Block index 13: Orange triangular wedge (positioned on left)
6. Block index 14: Orange triangular wedge (x2, positioned on right and for the roof)
7. Block index 16: Orange triangular wedge (positioned on right)

# Assembly Order

```
{
    Step1: Move block with index 9
    Step2: Move block with index 9
    Step3: Move block with index 7
    Step4: Move block with index 6
    Step5: Move block with index 6
    Step6: Move block with index 13
    Step7: Move block with index 14
    Step8: Move block with index 16
    Step9: Move block with index 1
    Step10: Move block with index 14
}
```

This assembly sequence starts with the base cylindrical columns, adds the green rectangular blocks for stability, positions the triangular wedges around the base, places the red arch on top of the cylinders, and finally adds the triangular roof piece.
